explain: A bright yellow gatso speed camera used to enforce the 30 mph speed limit in a residential road in Handsworth, Birmingham, but it has not been operational for more than two years since every fixed device was switched off in the West Midlands.
In 2013, 300 fixed cameras were turned off, and they were replaced by mobile units and officers to enforce the 30mph speed limit in Handsworth, Birmingham.
There is an issue with a mysteriously repointed camera in Wellington Road, and there are currently no plans for a pilot program in the area related to speed limit enforcement.
